stock

Class Store

  • java.lang.Object
    • stock.Store

  • public class Store
extends java.lang.Object
    An object representing a store. Since the program only supports one store, the class was written using the Singleton pattern.
    Author:
    Ashley Husband

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getCapital()
      Returns the capital of the Store
      static Store getInstance()
      Returns the instance of the Store, initialising it if it does not already exist
      stock.Stock getInventory()
      Returns the inventory of the Store
      java.util.List<stock.Item> getItemList()
      Returns the list of items carried by the Store
      static void loadSalesLog(java.lang.String fileName)
      This static method loads a sales log file and updates the inventory and captital accordingly.
      void modifyCapital(double amountToAdd)
      Modifies the capital of the Store by adding a number (number can be negative to subtract money)
      void setItemList(java.util.List<stock.Item> list)
      Sets the Store's item list and inventory as the passed item list (This method is called by the GUI to set up the item properties)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • modifyCapital

        public void modifyCapital(double amountToAdd)
        Modifies the capital of the Store by adding a number (number can be negative to subtract money)
        Parameters:
        amountToAdd - the amount to modify the capital by

      • getInventory

        public stock.Stock getInventory()
        Returns the inventory of the Store
        Returns:
        the inventory as a Stock

      • getItemList

        public java.util.List<stock.Item> getItemList()
        Returns the list of items carried by the Store
        Returns:
        the item list

      • setItemList

        public void setItemList(java.util.List<stock.Item> list)
                 throws stock.StockException
        Sets the Store's item list and inventory as the passed item list (This method is called by the GUI to set up the item properties)
        Parameters:
        list - the list of items being passed
        Throws:
        stock.StockException - if one of the items in the list cannot be added

      • loadSalesLog

        public static void loadSalesLog(java.lang.String fileName)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                stock.StockException,
                                csv.CSVFormatException
        This static method loads a sales log file and updates the inventory and captital accordingly.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the sales log file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file does not exist
        stock.StockException - If an item cannot be created
        csv.CSVFormatException - If the file is in the incorrect format
